title: Were there ever moose in Germany? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, sure - the Moose, Elk (or Elch in German) was everywhere, also Germany and Germania while Roman Rule - but was gone from Germany by c. 1600 Apparently the well known Roman Cesar wrote (well copied Eratosthenes of Cyrene’s Story) that the Germanic tribes liked to hunt it as it was so easy, because the “liked to lean against a tree at night to sleep” ..well if that’s true I leave to you and another question ;)

Yes and no. There are no “moose” in Europe, that’s derived from the Algonquin name for what we call an elk, What Americans call an elk we call a red deer. There were elk in most of Northern Europe in the past, and even now they are found in Poland and points East, and every now and then they stray into Germany. So I guess the answer you’d like is that there used to be and occasionally still are moose in Germany.
